item.description:
Lets have some sushi at this awesome place called Symphony Sushi.

It's near Huntington Ave so it's super convenient by public transportation.

We can then head out to The New England Conservatory of Music to attend the opening of the 2012-2013 orchestra season.

Hugh Wolff, Stanford and Norma Jean Calderwood Director of Orchestras, and the NEC Philharmonia open with three dramatic symphonic works: Beethoven’s “Leonore” Overture No. 3, one of several he wrote for the opera that became Fidelio; John Adams’s Dr. Atomic Symphony, and Brahms’ Symphony No. 4.

For more deets go to http://necmusic.edu/nec-philharmonia-wolff

Great idea!
item.how_to_find_us: The reservations will be under my name, the waitstaff will seat you at our table.
item.name: Sushi and free classical music concert afterwards! Beethoven anyone?
